thread.title: Woman sought in Lakeview jewelry theft
thread.title_full: Woman sought in Lakeview jewelry theft - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: Kelly Weston, Digital Content Producer
title: Woman sought in Lakeview jewelry theft
text:
NEW ORLEANS, LA (WVUE) - The NOPD is asking for the public’s help in locating a woman sought in connection with the theft of a $16,000 wedding ring set.
The suspect is 44-year-old Tricia Smith Sauvinet, who also goes by Tricia Caminita. The incident was reported on June 10 in the 300 block of 22nd Street.
Police said in early May, the victim took off her wedding rings while inside her home and put them in a metal container in her bathroom. When she went to get them, she discovered they were missing.
During the course of the investigation, detectives learned that the victim’s friend, Sauvinet, stole the rings and pawned them. Detectives then obtained a warrant for her arrest.
Third District Detectives are investigating the incident and can be contacted at (504) 658-6030.
Citizens with information that can help solve this crime are asked to call Crimestoppers at 822-1111 or toll-free 1-877-903-STOP. You could receive a cash reward of up to $2,500 for the information leading only to the arrest, except on homicides, where Crimestoppers will pay half of the reward upon the arrest and half on the indictment of the responsible person(s). You do not have to give your name nor testify to receive the reward but you must contact Crimestoppers directly with your information. Citizens can also submit an anonymous tip online to Crimestoppers at www.crimestoppersgno.org
